org.alanly.calculator.logic
Class EquationUtilities

java.lang.Object
  org.alanly.calculator.logic.EquationUtilities

public class EquationUtilities
extends java.lang.Object

Contains static utility methods to handle arithmetic equations and work with numbers.

EquationUtilities

public EquationUtilities()
Method Detail

generatePostfix

public static java.util.Queue<java.lang.String> generatePostfix(java.util.Queue<java.lang.String> inputEquation)
Generates a Postfix (Polish Notation) equation from an Infix equation. Infix equation must be in the form of an Queue and output will be in the form of a Queue. Assumes that input Queue contains valid values.

Parameters:
inputEquation - the Infix equation to convert into Postfix
Returns:
the Postfix equivalence of inputEquation

solvePostfixEquation

public static java.math.BigDecimal solvePostfixEquation(java.util.Queue<java.lang.String> postfixEquation)
Solves a given arithmetic equation that has been formatted in Postfix (Polish Notation). The Postfix equation must be presented as a F.I.F.O. Queue. Operations are performed through the BigDecimal object with a 64-bit precision level (MathContext.DECIMAL64) in order to keep compatibility with the double data type.

Parameters:
postfixEquation - the Postfix equation in Queue format
Returns:
the result of the calculation as a BigDecimal
See Also:
BigDecimal, MathContext

isNumber

public static boolean isNumber(java.lang.String input)
Determines whether a String is a valid number value. Returns a true if the input is a valid Double and false if the input is invalid.

Parameters:
input - the String to validate
Returns:
a boolean representing the validity of the input

isNumber

public static boolean isNumber(char input)
Determines whether a Character is a valid number value. Returns a true if the input is a valid Double and false if the input is invalid.

Parameters:
input - the Character to validate
Returns:
a boolean representing the validity of the input
